NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT
Station KUOM
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis 14, Minnesota
April I?, 1958
Mr. Sam L. Becker
Director, Division of
Television-Radio-Film
State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Sam;
I am glad to know that you are thinking about the future
of NAEB research.
You ask how much money we may have for research next
year. The NAEB request now before the Ford Foundation asks
for a very sizeable sum of money for this. So far we haven't
heard anything, which fact may be related to the unfortunate
death in the Capital Airlines Viscount accident in Michigan
a couple of weeks ago of John K. Weiss, the Foundation's
liaison person for all radio and television projects.
We are doing the best we can to expedite a reply from
the Foundation, consistent with the proprieties and also
with the inevitable dislocation of the radio and television
grant machinery caused by John's death. Until we do hear
from them, though, I am afraid nobody can answer the question
of how much money we are going to have for research next
year. We can, though, say that the amount we asked for was
considerable!
I doubt if there are any Association funds which could
pay travel for research committee members to the Columbus
Institute. However, I see that you sent Harry Skornia a
copy of your letter, and therefore he will be answering it
too. He can correct me if I'm wrong.
Yours sincerely
Burton Paulu
President
